title: 2021 New York City Comptroller election
deleted: *[[2021 New York City Public Advocate election]]

title: 2021 New York City Comptroller election
added: Candidates who raise at least $125,000 from at least 500 donors qualify for [[Matching_funds#State_funds_for_state_and_local_candidates_(US)|matching city funds]] from the [[New York City Campaign Finance Board]], on an 8-to-1 match basis.<ref>[https://gothamist.com/news/city-doles-out-historic-sum-taxpayer-funded-campaign-cash]</ref>  As of February 16, 2021, three candidates had qualified for matching funds: Brian Benjamin, Zach Iscol, and Brad Lander.<ref>[https://gothamist.com/news/city-doles-out-historic-sum-taxpayer-funded-campaign-cash]</ref>

title: 2021 New York City Comptroller election
added: Candidates who raise at least $125,000 from at least 500 donors qualify for [[Matching_funds#State_funds_for_state_and_local_candidates_(US)|matching city funds]] from the [[New York City Campaign Finance Board]], on an 8-to-1 match basis.<refname="auto">{{Cite web|url=http://gothamist.com/news/city-doles-out-historic-sum-taxpayer-funded-campaign-cash|title=City Doles Out Historic Sum Of Taxpayer-Funded Campaign Cash|date=February 16, 2021|website=Gothamist}}</ref>  As of February 16, 2021, three candidates had qualified for matching funds: Brian Benjamin, Zach Iscol, and Brad Lander.<refname="auto"/>
